definitions.title: Literal Language
definitions.definition: Language that means exactly what it says. It describes facts or events as they actually are without comparison or exaggeration.
definitions.example: Example: The sun is hot today.
definitions.explanation: Literal language expresses facts directly without imaginative or symbolic meaning.

definitions.title: Figurative Language
definitions.definition: Language that uses figures of speech to create vivid or imaginative expressions that are not meant to be taken literally.
definitions.example: Example: The sun smiled down on us.
definitions.explanation: Figurative language adds color and emotion by comparing or exaggerating ideas for effect.

definitions.title: Analogy
definitions.definition: A comparison between two things that are alike in some way, often used to explain or clarify an idea.
definitions.example: Example: Life is like a box of chocolates ‚Äî you never know what you're going to get.
definitions.explanation: Analogy helps explain a concept by showing how it is similar to something familiar.

definitions.title: Simile
definitions.definition: A figure of speech that compares two different things using the words 'like' or 'as'.
definitions.example: Example: Her smile is as bright as the sun.
definitions.explanation: Similes use comparison words to highlight similarities between unlike things.

definitions.title: Metaphor
definitions.definition: A figure of speech that compares two unlike things directly without using 'like' or 'as'.
definitions.explanation: Metaphors imply a direct comparison to create a strong image or meaning.

definitions.title: Personification
definitions.definition: A figure of speech that gives human qualities or characteristics to nonhuman objects or abstract ideas.
definitions.example: Example: The wind whispered through the trees.
definitions.explanation: Personification makes objects or ideas feel alive or relatable by giving them human traits.

definitions.title: Comparison
definitions.definition: A statement that shows how two or more things are similar or different, often used to clarify meaning or create imagery.
definitions.example: Example: This book is heavier than that one.
definitions.explanation: Comparisons are used to highlight similarities or differences between things.

definitions.title: Contrast
definitions.definition: A figure of speech that shows how two or more things are different from each other.
definitions.example: Example: Unlike his brother, Mark prefers silence over noise.
definitions.explanation: Contrast emphasizes differences between two ideas, objects, or people.

definitions.title: Figure of Speech
definitions.definition: A word or phrase used in a non-literal way to produce a rhetorical effect or emphasize meaning.
definitions.example: Example: I'm so hungry I could eat a horse.
definitions.explanation: Figures of speech make language more expressive and imaginative.
